intro: Tragium broteri, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are often clustered in a compact head. It is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Tragium broteri is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
